alert.note: Alert for Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 2:57PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the lower elevations and 18 to 22 inches over Lookout Pass and the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, Evaro Hill, Highway 2 Kalispell to Libby, Highway 37 Eureka to Libby, Highway 56 Bull Lake Road, Highway 93 Eureka to Whitefish, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Alberton. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region
